name: 46694R302 - ITP - LEVEL 29 - Installation of RIS Anchor Points SA 141 Trimdek
template name: 46694R302 - ITP - LEVEL 29 - Installation of RIS Anchor Points SA 141 Trimdek

name: Roof profile minimum fixings and type

Position and orientation of anchor
point to roof
Additional pendulum fixing points to roof to allow safe transition and
Number of fixing and location of fixing to anchor point
CHARACTERISTICS - AS5532 7.1 a, b, c, d, e, f & g
REFERENCE - Systems can be accessed safely by trained persons without the risk of an uncontrolled fall
Roof profile and minimum BMT match and corrosion check completed TRIMDEK
REFERENCE - Roof profile type matched minimum BMT .42 and roof sheeting displays no signs of surface corrosion
Minimum roof sheet width and length

REFERENCE - 3 x normal lapped roof sheets wide and crossing a minimum of three purlins or battens. Roof sheet can be fixed directly to purlin or timber batten which is fixed directly to structural steel or timber truss/rafter or additionally, purlin/tophat, blue metal/top hat and top hat/reroof.
Position and orientation of anchor point to Trimdek roof
REFERENCE - Centred between purlins/batten smiley face located away from the intended working edge for pendulum applications
REFERENCE - Screw fixed at crest over minimum 3 purlin/batten with a minimum 15 - 12x14x50 metal/timber tek screw in the 3 purlin/batten
REFERENCE - Pendulum anchors 2 x 8mm Bulb Tite Rivets to adjacent roof sheet lap 150mm apart
Anchor points to roof to prevent lateral swing fall are installed or mitigation agreed
REFERENCE - The distance to the next anchor is less than the length to the closest edge, unless mitigated by other means
Anchor at entry point with a stainless steel Strop
REFERENCE - Anchor strop must be positioned to enable user to reach and connect to.
○ Strop is marked and rated to the roof anchor point rating. Mallion/Quicklink connection to roof anchor point is secured and mechanically tightened or chemically set with loctite.
COMMENTS - Not applicable as anchor is not within the Fall Zone.
REFERENCE - Dissimilar metals are separated by foam, tape, EPDM barrier or sealant. NOTE: It's acceptable to have some paper remain on the FOAM during installation.
Site clean up and picture evidence if handover is not possible

REFERENCE - Site has been cleared of swarf or other debris installation inspection completed and witnessed by the customers representative. Where a client cannot sign for handover, clear high resolution pictures have been taken of each anchor point.
REFERENCE - Anchor fit for use sticker/tag filled in and attached to the anchor point, mark with confirmed rating. Entry point signage updated and installed.
Handover operating and systems documentation issued
I have carried out all necessary inspections and verify that the above items/activities conform to the contract specification/documents

name: Roof profile minimum fixings and type
Position and orientation of anchor point to roof
Additional pendulum fixing points to roof to allow safe transition and
Number of fixing and location of fixing to anchor point
CHARACTERISTICS - AS5532 7.1 a, b, c, d, e, f & g
CHECKLIST - Installation (Refer to Installation Instructions) / Fill in the appropriate section based on the installed roof sheet.
REFERENCE - Systems can be accessed safely by trained persons without the risk of an uncontrolled fall
Minimum roof sheet width and length

REFERENCE - 3 x normal lapped roof sheets wide and crossing a minimum of three purlins or battens. Roof sheet must be fixed directly to purlin or timber batten which is fixed directly to structural steel or timber truss/rafter or additionally, purlin/tophat, blue metal/top hat and top hat/reroof.
○ WARNING: DO NOT INSTALL ON RISERS AND KLIPLOK SHEETING APPLICATIONS
Roof profile and minimum BMT match and corrosion check completed
REFERENCE - Roof profile type matched minimum BMT .48 and roof sheeting displays no signs of surface corrosion
REFERENCE - Check that the roof sheet is fixed off securely to the underlying purlin;
○ Visual check from inside of building that clips are installed. Visual check at the gutter line that clips are installed.
○ Verify the roof is installed as per manufacturers instruction via Roofers warranty.
○ Drill pilot hole over purlin where anchor is being positioned to check clips are installed.
Roof profile and minimum BMT match and corrosion check completed
REFERENCE - Roof profile type matched minimum BMT.42 and roof sheeting displays no signs of surface corrosion
REFERENCE - Check that the roof sheet is fixed off securely to the underlying purlin;
○ Visual check from inside of building that clips are installed. Visual check at the gutter line that clips are installed.
○ Verify the roof is installed as per manufacturers instruction via Roofers warranty.
○ Drill pilot hole over purlin where anchor is being positioned to check clips are installed.
REFERENCE - METLOK 500, KLIP-LOK 406 and KLIP-LOK 700 2 x 14 x 14 x 75 Roof Teks penetrating the support Purlin or Batten above the anchor point for access below the anchor and on pendulum points.
○ METLOK 500, KLIP-LOK 406 and KLIP-LOK 700 2 x 14 x 14 x 75 Roof Teks penetrating the support Purlin or Batten below the anchor where the anchor point is used above the anchor or at pendulum points.
REFERENCE - Minimum 8 x 8mm Bulb Tite Rivets, 2 x 14 x 14 x 75 Roof Teks.
Position and orientation of anchor point to all clip fixed roof profiles
REFERENCE - Centred over purlin/battens smiley face located away from the intended working edge for pendulum applications
Anchor points to roof to prevent lateral swing fall are installed or mitigation agreed
REFERENCE - The distance to the next anchor is less than the length to the closest edge, unless mitigated by other means
Anchor at entry point with a stainless steel Strop
REFERENCE - Anchor strop must be positioned to enable user to reach and connect to.
○ Strop is marked and rated to or above the roof anchor point rating.
○ Mallion/Quicklink connection to roof anchor point is secured and mechanically tightened or chemically set with loctite.
COMMENTS - Not applicable as anchor is not within the Fall Zone.
REFERENCE - Dissimilar metals are separated by foam, tape, EPDM barrier or sealant. NOTE: It's acceptable to have some paper remain on the FOAM during installation.
Site clean up and picture evidence if handover is not possible

REFERENCE - Site has been cleared of swarf or other debris installation inspection completed and witnessed by the customers representative. Where a client cannot sign for handover, clear high resolution pictures have been taken of each anchor point.
REFERENCE - Anchor fit for use sticker/tag filled in and attached to the anchor point, mark with confirmed rating. Entry point signage updated and installed.
